alert.note: Alert for Bond (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 9:09PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Illinois, including the following counties, Bond and Fayette. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 909 PM CDT, the public reported flooding across Bond county including along Route 127, which is flooded in multiple locations due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area during the remainder of the evening. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Mulberry Grove, Woburn, Pleasant Mound, Pittsburg, Smithboro and Hagerstown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
